posts.post_content: Oh hey there Serra Angel, it's been two core sets since we noticed you. Why is everyone rating you so low? I think you deserve a solid 4 stars for being iconic and, yes I dare say, even reasonably powerful. Nevermind what the haters say; Magic still loves you.

Posted By: CJM2 (7/21/2011 8:41:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
God, how can I sum up how awesome this card is and continues to be? It has an evasion skill, can attack *and* block every single turn under normal circümstances, and is [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt)-proof.  
  
Yeah, Walletslayer will net you life every time you attack/block with it usually, and is beefier, but you either have to use it offensively or defensively. Most times that isn't an issue, but when it is, Serra really comes through.
posts.html:
God, how can I sum up how awesome this card is and continues to be? It has an evasion skill, can attack and block every single turn under normal circümstances, and is Lightning Bolt-proof.

Yeah, Walletslayer will net you life every time you attack/block with it usually, and is beefier, but you either have to use it offensively or defensively. Most times that isn't an issue, but when it is, Serra really comes through.

posts.post_content:
I like how M12 has a big creature at uncommon for each color. This for white, [Belltower Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Belltower Sphinx) for blue, [Sengir Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sengir Vampire) for black, [Volcanic Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Dragon) for red, and I'm not sure abot green. [Cudgel Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cudgel Troll) or [Carnage Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carnage Wurm), maybe?  
This Angel has seen better days. From what I heard, she was the win condition of the infamous [Stasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stasis ) deck. I'd love to open one of these in limited.

posts.post_content: The game was so much better when this was rare and so was [Righteousness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Righteousness). I feel like dropping a Sera Angel and making a comeback with it is so much more fun than dropping something huge (see Superllama's links) and completely shunting their hopes for a comeback unless they have the removal. Anyone remember when a [two-power one-drop no-drawbacks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=83246) was something special? Posted By: En_Sigma (10/13/2011 8:26:34 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Just to correct the mistaken beliefs I keep reading in these comments: Yes, [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) is better. People keep getting low ratings on their comments for saying this apparently, but it's true. Serra Angel is iconic and, dare I say it, cooler, but not a strictly better card. Baneslayer Angel is still a she. Almost all Angels in Magic are shes, with only two exceptions: [Malach of the Dawn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Malach of the Dawn) and [Gabriel Angelfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gabriel Angelfire). And [Visions of Beyond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Visions of Beyond) is so far from being broken. So far.  
  
I love Serra Angel. She's the iconic angel. And to think she almost didn't get her name. Thanks to her, Serra exists, one of my favorite Magic characters.
posts.html:

Almost all Angels in Magic are shes, with only two exceptions: Malach of the Dawn and Gabriel Angelfire. And Visions of Beyond is so far from being broken. So far.

I love Serra Angel. She's the iconic angel. And to think she almost didn't get her name. Thanks to her, Serra exists, one of my favorite Magic characters.

posts.post_content:
Her flavor text should read: "*Follow the light. In its absence, follow [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel). In her absence, follow her.*"  
  
But yay! Overpowered BS Angel is gone! Not really overpowered, but just "Oh, lets make a powerful creature without it being special."

posts.post_content:
Unlike [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel), Serra Angel, one of my first favourite Magic cards (I love the[Revised art](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=1366)), is extremely difficult to [assassinate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=assassinate) or [death stroke](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=death stroke). She is also immune to [Gideon Jura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gideon Jura)'s -2 abililty.   
  
Serra Angel, we love you.

posts.post_content: I love this card. I has pretty high power and toughness, two great abilities, is very iconic and BALANCED!!! People seem to forget that being good doesn't mean [overpowered](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=205077) and [necessary to play a playset in every deck of it's color](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=195297). This makes a fine beater, and is right where the power level should be (unlike [Walletslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=205077)). I enjoy using this card more than using Walletslayer, if only because it still gives everyone else a chance, and makes for a fair, fun fight (try saying that five times fast)!
posts.html:

posts.post_content: One of the few angels in the game (recently) that doesn't freak me out. The angels of Mirrodin have fallen to Phyrexia, and the Angels of Alara and Zendikar are distant, detached and alien to the plane's "real" creatures. Also, the flavor text is brilliant. If taken as coming from a priest, it means the angel. If coming from the angel, however, it's saying you should follow Serra. Her death is debatable, due to Karona's journey.
posts.html:
